captions.text:
You're coming out ofTangier.
Is that correct?

What's the, uh, nature
of your visit to Naples?

Look, I don't know what you did,
and I don't know
who you're working for.
But I promise you this--

you're gonna play ball
one way or the other.
[ Exhales ] This is Nevins.

This is Tom Cronin, C.I. Operations Officer
calling from Langley, Virginia.

- Do you have a Jason Bourne in custody?
- Yes, I do.
Listen, he's an agency priority target.

Call me back
as soon as he's secure.
I understand.

He's been detained.
Here's the number.

- [ Engine Starts ]
- [ Cell Phone Ringing ]

- Hello.
- This is Pamela Landy, C.I. supervisor.
<i>Where do we stand?</i>

- I, uh, think he got away.
- [ Exhales ]
Damn it.

- Have you locked down the area?
- Locked it down? No. No.

This is, uh-- This is Italy.
They don't exactly lock down--

- How long have you
worked for the agency?
- Me? For four years.

Last week in Berlin
he assassinated two men--
one a highly experienced field officer.

I want you to secure that area.
I want any evidence secured,
and I want it done right now.

Is that clear?
Yes, sir-- ma'am.

I'm getting on a plane to Berlin
in 45 minutes, which means
you're gonna call me back in 30.

<i>And when I ask you where we stand,</i>
<i>I had better be impressed.</i>

title: The Bourne Supremacy (3/9) Movie CLIP - Escaping in Naples (2004) HD

this happened to them.﻿

comments.text:
The Bourne Legacy was horrible, Supremacy was easily the best in the 
series.  Let met get this straight, Jason Bourne is a ex-CIA officer with 
amnesia, who can't remember his real name, but remembers all of his CIA 
fighting and spy tactics. :P  
Fun Fact: Langley, Virginia is CIA HQ ﻿
comments.author: Sam O

comments.text:
+Sam O Jason Bourne was a contract assassin working for Treadstone which 
was a black ops branch of the CIA. Because Treadstone had to break down the 
agents before they were operational, some had severe side effects like 
headaches. Bourne was the only one who had amnesia. Treadstone knew that if 
Bourne found out who he was, he'd be gunning for them.

All his fighting he remembers because it's like a second nature to him, 
like speaking another language. He doesn't know how he can do it, but he 
can still do it.
comments.author: SmokeyVox

comments.text:
Many people who suffer from amnesia can still remember basic tasks and 
learned skills, such as typing, math, language, etc., that are the result 
of conditioning and repetitive learning, even though they have no memory of 
who they are or anything about their past. For example, person with amnesia 
who knows how to play piano can still play the piano in spite of not being 
able to remember a single lesson because it has become second nature to 
them. That's because retrograde amnesia affects a different part of the 
brain - the part that stores long-term memory - from the part where learned 
skills are located.

comments.text:
pretty sure the one punch guard got hit near the temple actually, the cia 
officer took two near the jaw. if you watch carefully, the neck wasn't hit. 
they were knocked out by blunt force. also, as far as I know getting struck 
in the adam's apple may stun someone resulting in them falling to the 
ground chocking, but it won't knock them out. that is to say, they won't 
lose consciousnesses (assuming you dont crush their windpipe and kill 
them...)
